Partly cloudy PERIOD Low 56F PERIOD Winds light and variable PERIOD

Updated November     pm



Sherlock Holmes and his faithful assistant Watson made their way
onto the Orange Coast College campus last week with the opening of
Arthur Conan Doyles play Sherlock Holmes. the highly intelligent Holmes and his partner made their debut
last Friday night along with the other  actors and did not
disappoint the audience with their spectacular performances PERIOD

Directed by Alex Golson the cast performed Sir Arthur Conan
Doyles famous version with their own little twist Golson added
four more members than the original script called for PERIOD

Filled with mystery violence and romantic interest Sherlock
Holmes includes elements to entertain many different age groups PERIOD
Holmes must find a way to defeat his arch enemy Professor
Moriarty while also saving his damsel in distress Alice
Faulkner PERIOD

Fist fighting and violence definitely draw the crowd in and keep
them sitting on the edge of their seats wondering what is going to
happen next PERIOD

The costumes and set resembled that of the 1890s which was the
plays original setting PERIOD Utilizing special lighting and pyrotechnic
effects the performance made the audience feel like they were on
stage walking around with Holmes and Watson PERIOD

Leading actors Chris Arnold and Raymond Mau are a good match for
one another on stage PERIOD They made a very convincing Holmes and Watson
through witty banter and playful blocking techniques PERIOD

The actors appeared to have great chemistry on the stage which
really made the performance come to life before the eyes of the
audience PERIOD

Isabella Chavez who plays the Match Girl and a street singer
really brought the setting of the era to the stage PERIOD

Additional performances of Sherlock Holmes will be held in the
Robert B PERIOD Moore Theater at  p.m PERIOD Friday and Sunday and also
Sunday at  p.m PERIOD Tickets cost  at the door for general
admission and  at the door for students senior citizens and
children PERIOD
